SEARCH
Package org.hms.views

Class AdminMenu

java.lang.Object
org.hms.views.AbstractMenu
org.hms.views.AbstractMainMenu
org.hms.views.AdminMenu
public class AdminMenu extends AbstractMainMenu
The AdminMenu class handles the display and execution of menu options specific to the administrator role. It provides functionalities for managing hospital staff, viewing scheduled appointments, managing medication inventory, and other administrative tasks. This class extends AbstractMainMenu and ensures that only users with administrator privileges can access these functionalities.

  • Field Details

    • scanner

      private final Scanner scanner
      A Scanner instance used to capture input from the console. This is declared as a final variable to ensure only one instance is created and used throughout the lifetime of the AdminMenu.

    • userContext

      private final UserContext userContext
      The UserContext associated with the current admin session. This variable holds the essential user information needed to validate and authorize administrative actions within the menu.

    • staffManagementService

      private final StaffManagementService staffManagementService
      Service responsible for managing hospital staff operations within the AdminMenu context. This includes adding, updating, and removing staff, as well as other staff-related functionalities.

      This service interacts with the main application logic to handle staff-specific tasks required by the admin.

  • Constructor Details

    • AdminMenu

      public AdminMenu(App app)
      Constructs an instance of AdminMenu, initializing its context with the given App instance. This constructor initializes the scanner, userContext, and staffManagementService fields, and ensures that the current user has administrative privileges.
      Parameters:
      app - the instance of the App class that provides the necessary services and context

  • Method Details

    • validateAdminAccess

      private void validateAdminAccess()
      Validates whether the current user has administrator access. If the user does not have admin privileges or userContext is null, an access denied message is displayed, and the application redirects to the authentication menu.

    • displayAndExecute

      public void displayAndExecute()
      Displays the administrator menu and handles the execution of selected options. The options provided in the menu include:
      1. View and manage hospital staff
      2. View scheduled appointments details
      3. View and manage medication inventory
      4. Approve or reject replenishment requests
      5. Logout
      The method will prompt the administrator to select an option and will continuously display the menu until the logout option is selected. This method also prints a low stock alert message upon entering the menu.
      Specified by:
      displayAndExecute in class AbstractMenu

    • printLowStockAlertMessage

      private void printLowStockAlertMessage()
      Prints a low stock alert message if there are any drugs running low in stock. This method retrieves the drug entries that are low in stock from the drug dispensary service and prints them in an ASCII table format to the console with a yellow-colored alert message. If there are no drugs running low in stock, the method does nothing.

    • handleViewAppointments

      private void handleViewAppointments()
      Handles the action of viewing all scheduled appointments.

      This method calls the AppointmentService to display all scheduled appointments. It is intended to be used by administrative users to view detailed appointment information. The method does not take any parameters and does not return any values.

    • handleManageDrugInventory

      private void handleManageDrugInventory()
      Handles the drug inventory management operations. This method displays the Manage Drug Inventory menu and allows the user to choose options related to viewing, adding, deleting, updating drug quantities, updating low stock thresholds, or exiting back to the main menu. Users must enter a valid number to select an option, and invalid inputs will prompt an error message.

      Options include: 1. Viewing the current drug stock. 2. Adding a new drug to the inventory. 3. Deleting an existing drug from the inventory. 4. Updating the quantity of an existing drug. 5. Updating the low stock threshold for alerts. 6. Exiting to the main menu.

      The method continuously prompts the user until the exit option (6) is selected.

    • handleUpdateLowStockThreshold

      private void handleUpdateLowStockThreshold()
      Handles the update of the low stock threshold for a drug in the inventory. This method interacts with the user through the console to select a drug entry and set a new low stock threshold. It displays a list of drug entries, prompts the user to select an entry by ID, and then prompts for a new threshold value. The updated threshold is applied and confirmed or a failure message is displayed.

      The method uses color coding for console messages to indicate different types of output such as headers, errors, and confirmations. It validates user inputs to ensure they are correct and handles invalid entries gracefully.

      The Drug Dispansary Service is utilized to perform actions such as fetching the current drug inventory, validating entry IDs, retrieving drug names and setting new low stock thresholds.

      If the update is successful, the action is logged and a confirmation message is shown to the user. If there is a failure, an error message is displayed prompting the user to try again.

      The user can return to the previous menu by entering -1 as the drug EntryID.

    • handleUpdateDrugQuantity

      private void handleUpdateDrugQuantity()
      Handles the process of updating the quantity of drugs in the dispensary inventory. This method displays the current drug inventory, prompts the user to select a drug entry by its ID, and allows the quantity of the selected drug to be updated.

      The user can input the entry ID of the drug they wish to update. If the entered ID is valid, they are then prompted to input the new quantity for that drug. The inventory is updated accordingly.

      If the user enters an invalid ID, they are informed of the error and prompted to try again. If the update is successful, a confirmation message is displayed; otherwise, an error message is shown. The method also logs the update action if it is successful.

      This method runs in a loop until a valid update is made or the user chooses to exit by entering -1.

    • handleDeleteDrug

      private void handleDeleteDrug()
      Handles the process of deleting a drug from the dispensary inventory.

      This method displays the current drug inventory to the user and prompts for the EntryID of the drug to be deleted. The user can enter -1 to go back. It performs validation on the entered EntryID and attempts to remove the drug from the inventory if the EntryID is valid. The method logs the actions taken and provides feedback to the user about the success or failure of the deletion process.

    • handleDisplayAllDrugs

      private void handleDisplayAllDrugs()
      Displays the entire drug inventory in the console.

      This method prints the drug inventory title with a blue color, retrieves the current drug inventory as a string from the drug dispensary service, and prints the result in the console.

    • handleAddNewDrug

      private void handleAddNewDrug()
      Handles the addition of a new drug to the dispensary.

      This method prompts the administrator to enter the name, quantity, and low stock alert threshold for a new drug. It handles user input and validation, ensuring numeric entries where necessary. If the drug already exists in the system, it notifies the user and terminates the process. If all inputs are valid and the drug doesn't already exist, it proceeds to add the new drug to the dispensary via the DrugDispensaryService.

      The method also provides user feedback for successful or failed drug additions using colored console output to enhance readability.

    • handleApproveReplenishmentRequests

      private void handleApproveReplenishmentRequests()
      Handles the process of approving or rejecting drug replenishment requests.

      This method displays all current replenishment requests and prompts the admin to approve or reject individual requests by their EntryID. The admin can also approve all requests at once by entering 'a'. The selection and action are validated and appropriate messages are displayed based on success or failure.

      The admin's actions are logged for audit purposes.

    • handleManageHospitalStaff

      private void handleManageHospitalStaff()
      Handles the management of hospital staff, providing options to add, update, remove, view, and filter staff members. It also allows returning to the main menu. This method runs in a loop until the user chooses to exit to the main menu. It presents the user with a menu of options related to staff management and processes the user's input to call the appropriate handler methods.

    • handleAddStaff

      private void handleAddStaff()
      Handles the process of adding a new staff member to the system.

      This method prompts the user for the necessary details to create a new staff member, including staff ID, full name, age, role, status, and gender. It processes the input to construct a Staff object and then attempts to add this new staff member to the system. If the addition is successful and the role is "Doctor", it updates all schedules with the new doctor.

      In case of any invalid numeric input or other exceptions during the process, appropriate error messages are displayed to the user.

      Positively adds a new staff member and logs the admin action if successful. Otherwise, it informs the user of the failure and possible reasons.

      Exceptions: - NumberFormatException: If numeric inputs such as age or role choice are not valid integers. - IllegalArgumentException: If an invalid role choice is made. - Exception: For generic error handling.

    • handleUpdateStaff

      private void handleUpdateStaff()
      Handles the update process for staff information.

      This method prompts the admin to input the staff ID they wish to update and fetches the corresponding staff details from the system. The admin is then prompted to enter new values for the staff member's name, age, and role. If an input is left blank, the corresponding field is not updated.

      The updated staff information is then saved back to the system. If the update is successful, an appropriate message is displayed and an admin action is logged. If the update fails or an error occurs, an error message is displayed.

      Exceptions are caught, and relevant error messages are displayed to the console.

    • handleRemoveStaff

      private void handleRemoveStaff()
      Handles the removal of a staff member from the system.

      This method prompts the admin to input the ID of the staff member to be removed and whether the removal should be a soft delete (marking the staff member as inactive) or a hard delete. It then attempts to remove the staff member using the staffManagementService.

      If the removal is successful, a success message is displayed and the action is logged. If the removal fails, an error message is displayed indicating the potential non-existence of the staff ID.

      Any exceptions encountered during the process will be caught, and an appropriate error message will be displayed.

    • handleViewStaff

      private void handleViewStaff()
      Displays the list of all staff members in a formatted table.

      This method retrieves the list of all staff members from the `staffManagementService` and prints the details of each staff member in a tabular format to the console.

      If no staff members are found, a message indicating this will be printed. The output is colorized using ANSI escape codes as defined in the `Colour` class. Additionally, an action log entry is created stating that the staff list was viewed.

    • handleFilterStaff

      private void handleFilterStaff()
      Handles the filtering of staff based on user-selected criteria such as role, gender, or age range.

      The method displays a set of filtering options to the user, prompts for input based on the chosen option, and outputs a list of staff members matching the given criteria. It catches and handles invalid user input.

    • logAdminAction

      private void logAdminAction(String action)
      Logs an administrative action performed by the current user within the hospital management system.
      Parameters:
      action - a description of the administrative action performed
